text:
I am getting the following error, trying to clone a private repo via ssh:
```(@v1.6) pkg> add <mailto:git@gitlab.com|git@gitlab.com>:cossio/MyPkg.jl.git
    Updating git-repo `<mailto:git@gitlab.com|git@gitlab.com>:cossio/MyPkg.jl.git`
SSH host verification: the identity of the server `<http://gitlab.com:22|gitlab.com:22>` does not match its known hosts record. Someone could be trying to man-in-the-middle your connection. It is also possible that the server has changed its key, in which case you should check with the server administrator and if they confirm that the key has been changed, update your known hosts file.
ERROR: failed to fetch from <mailto:git@gitlab.com|git@gitlab.com>:cossio/MyPkg.jl.git, error: GitError(Code:ERROR, Class:Net, user cancelled hostkey check)```

elements.text: I am getting the following error, trying to clone a private repo via ssh:

(@v1.6) pkg> add git@gitlab.com:cossio/MyPkg.jl.git
    Updating git-repo `git@gitlab.com:cossio/MyPkg.jl.git`
SSH host verification: the identity of the server `gitlab.com:22` does not match its known hosts record. Someone could be trying to man-in-the-middle your connection. It is also possible that the server has changed its key, in which case you should check with the server administrator and if they confirm that the key has been changed, update your known hosts file.
ERROR: failed to fetch from git@gitlab.com:cossio/MyPkg.jl.git, error: GitError(Code:ERROR, Class:Net, user cancelled hostkey check)

text: This is with Julia 1.6. I just upgraded. I did not have this issue with Julia 1.5

elements.text: This is with Julia 1.6. I just upgraded. I did not have this issue with Julia 1.5

text: (for what is worth, I'm not sure where that link points to)
